question: My 25 year old son has advanced Friedreich's ataxia, with cardiac issues, diabetes, vision and hearing loss.  He has begun to have hallucinations.  Sometimes it's as simple as thinking a cat is sleeping on his bed with him.  Other times, more frequently, he thinks people are masturbating in front of him.  I am so overwhelmed lately I just don't know where to start--neurology, psychiatry, please offer whatever advice you can.
title: hallucinations and Friedreich's ataxia
